summary: A character reference letter from Pandora Maxwell, the ex-wife of Ghislaine Maxwell's brother Kevin, to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application. The letter describes Ghislaine's character, family relationships, and philanthropic work, and offers a $33 million bond secured by Pandora's assets.

persons.name: Pandora Maxwell
persons.role: Author of character reference letter, ex-sister-in-law of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Writes a letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan vouching for Ghislaine Maxwell's character and offering a $33 million bond for her bail. She is the ex-wife of Kevin Maxwell and mother of seven children.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of the bail application, defendant
persons.context: Described by Pandora Maxwell as vivacious, intelligent, dedicated to ocean conservation, and a woman of principle who will appear in court to face charges she denies.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.role: Ghislaine Maxwell's brother, ex-husband of Pandora Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the ex-husband of the letter's author, Pandora Maxwell, and brother of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the character reference letter is addressed regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application.

connections.description: Pandora is the ex-sister-in-law of Ghislaine, having been married to Ghislaine's brother Kevin for 21 years. She has known Ghislaine since 1979 and describes a long, positive familial relationship.
Pandora is the ex-wife of Kevin Maxwell, to whom she was married for 21 years and with whom she has seven children.
Ghislaine and Kevin are siblings, part of a close family of seven surviving siblings.
Pandora offers to sign a $33 million bond, secured by all her assets, to support Ghislaine's bail application, stating financial ruin would result if Ghislaine violated release conditions.

events.title: Family Christmas hosted by Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell hosted a large family Christmas event, which Pandora Maxwell and six of her children (plus grandchildren) attended. The event also included Ghislaine's husband and extended family.

events.title: Family visit to Ghislaine's Manhattan home
events.description: Pandora Maxwell and her children visited Ghislaine Maxwell's home in Manhattan. Ghislaine was described as extremely busy with her philanthropic ocean conservation work.

events.title: Submission of bail support letter
events.description: Pandora Maxwell writes and submits a character reference letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan offering a $33 million bond in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Pandora Maxwell offers to sign a $33 million bond, secured by all her assets including her home, to support Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application.
The letter describes Ghislaine Maxwell as dedicated to ocean conservation philanthropy, including work with the UN and TED talks.
Pandora Maxwell states she has known Ghislaine since 1979 and has never believed media reports that Ghislaine was in hiding from law enforcement.
The letter reveals Ghislaine Maxwell hosted a large family Christmas in 2018 and has welcomed Pandora's children to New York on multiple occasions.
Pandora Maxwell asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell regards the United States as her home and has not been in the UK for any length of time in recent years.
